lines.content: Used ChatGPT to generate how to print a welcome message for the chatbot on opening the application. It took 1 prompt for ChatGPT to give the correct answer, as opposed to having to google without the context of a CLI chatbot.
Also used ChatGPT to find out how to make the profile picture for the user and the chatbot circle.

Angus is a desktop application that allows you to manage your tasks through simple command line instructions on a Graphical User Interface (GUI). Tasks are categorised into todos, deadlines and events.
Adds a todo task to your task list with the specified name.
- Creates a new todo task with the name `TASKNAME`
Angus will respond with an acknowledgment of the todo task added, indicated with [T].
You now have 1 tasks in the list
Adds a deadline task to your task list with the specified name and the deadline date.
- Creates a new deadline task with the name `TASKNAME` and the deadline date of `YYYY-MM-DD`
- The format of the date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Angus will respond with an acknowledgment of the deadline task added, indicated with [D].
You now have 2 tasks in the list
Adds an event task to your task list with the specified name, start date and end date.
- Creates a new event task with the name `TASKNAME`, with start date and end date specified by `YYYY-MM-DD` respectively.
- The format of the date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Angus will respond with an acknowledgment of the event task added, indicated with [E].
You now have 3 tasks in the list
Lists the tasks that you have in your task list in order added.
Angus will respond with the list of tasks you have, with the corresponding label for each type of task.
Marks a specified task in your list as done.
- Marks the task with the task number of TASKNUM as done, as specified by the numbering given in the `list` command.
- Tasks marked as done will have the label [X].
Angus will respond with an acknowledgment of successfully marking the task as done.
Angus has marked this task as done!
Marks a specified task in your list as ___NOT___ done. (i.e. undo the marking of a task)
- Marks the task with the task number of TASKNUM as ___NOT___ done, as specified by the numbering given in the `list` command.
- Tasks marked as ___NOT___ done will have the label [ ].
Angus will respond with an acknowledgment of successfully marking the task as ___NOT___ done.
Angus has marked this task as NOT done!
Finds tasks based on the filter keyword provided
- Finds all tasks who have `KEYWORD` in the task name (case-sensitive)
Angus will respond with a list of tasks that has the filter keyword in the task name.
Here are the matching tasks in your list
Sorts your task list based on start date for events, or deadline for deadline tasks. Sorting is not allowed for todo tasks.
- `TASKTYPE` can only either be event or deadline
Angus will respond with a list of (deadlines/events) by (deadline date/start date).
Here is your sorted list of deadlines:
Deletes a specified task in your list.
- Deletes the task with the task number of `TASKNUM`, as specified by the numbering given in the `list` command.
Angus will respond with an acknowledgment of successfully deleting the task
All done! Angus has removed this task:
You now have 3 tasks in your list

* Represents command to exit the chatbot application Angus.
* This class is responsible for saving the tasks stored in the TaskList and
* displaying the goodbye message to the user before ending the program loop.
* Constructs a new instance of the ByeCommand with the given Ui, Storage and TaskList.
* @param ui The instance of the user interface class Ui to interact with the user.
* @param storage The instance of the Storage class to save the tasks into a txt file.
* @param tasks The current list of tasks to be saved into a txt file.
public ByeCommand(Ui ui, Storage storage, TaskList tasks) {
* Represents the abstract base class for all commands.
* Each commands encapsulate an action that the command will execute when called, as well
* as whether the command is an exit command which will break out of the program loop.
* Represents the enumeration of all available commands known by Angus.
* Executes the given command when called.
* @throws AngusException If command cannot be executed.
public abstract String execute() throws AngusException;
* Defines whether a command is an exit command.
* An exit command is defined as a command that will lead to closing the program.
* @return Whether the command is an exit command.
* Represents the command to add a Deadline Task to the TaskList.
* This class is responsible for passing the deadlineName and endDate to the
* addDeadline method implemented by the TaskList class when the execute method
* is called. This class is not an exit command.
* Constructs a new instance of the DeadlineCommand class with the given TaskList, name and end date.
* @param tasks The current list of tasks.
* @param deadlineName The name of the new deadline task to be created.
* @param endDate The end date of the new deadline task to be created.
public DeadlineCommand(TaskList tasks, String deadlineName, LocalDate endDate) {
* Represents the command to delete a task given a task number.
* This class is responsible for calling the delete task method implemented by
* TaskList, given the task number to be deleted.
* Constructs a new instance of the DeleteCommand class with the given TaskList and task number to delete.
* @param tasks The current list of tasks.
* @param taskNum The task number (0-th index) to be deleted from the TaskList.
* Represents the command to create a new Event task given the event details.
* This class is responsible for calling the add event method implemented by the TaskList class,
* given the event's name, start and end date.
* Constructs a new instance of the EventCommand class with the given TaskList and event details.
* @param tasks The current list of tasks.
* @param eventName The name of the new event.
* @param startDate The start date of the new event.
* @param endDate The end date of the new event.
public EventCommand(TaskList tasks, String eventName, LocalDate startDate, LocalDate endDate) {

* when the chatbot is initialised, and saving the user's tasks to the storage file when
* Constructs a new instance of the Storage class with the specified storage file path.
